title: Masjid al-Haram
description: Explore the holiest mosque in Islam — the Grand Mosque of Mecca, which surrounds the sacred Kaaba.

scenes.title: The Gates of Al-Haram
scenes.description: The Grand Mosque has 95 gates. The most famous is Bab al-Salam (Gate of Peace), used traditionally for entering. As you step through, say 'Bismillah' and recite the dua for entering the mosque.

scenes.title: First Sight of the Kaaba
scenes.description: The moment you first see the Kaaba, raise your hands and make dua — this is a moment when prayers are accepted. Take a moment to absorb the magnitude of what you are witnessing.

scenes.title: The Sacred Kaaba
scenes.description: The cube-shaped structure draped in black Kiswah cloth embroidered with gold Quranic verses. Prophet Ibrahim and his son Ismail built this house of worship. All Muslims face it during prayer.

scenes.title: Hajar al-Aswad
scenes.description: Embedded in the southeastern corner at about shoulder height. The Black Stone was placed by the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). It is 'kissed' or pointed to at the start of each circuit of Tawaf.

scenes.title: The Zamzam Well
scenes.description: Below the mosque floor, the ancient well of Zamzam has been providing water for thousands of years. Drinking stations are throughout the mosque. This water is holy and carries blessings.

scenes.title: Safa and Marwa Corridor
scenes.description: The marble-floored corridor connecting the two hills of Safa and Marwa. Air-conditioned and covered, it stretches about 450 meters. Pilgrims walk this path seven times during Sa'i.

title: Mina Valley
description: Discover the Valley of Mina, where pilgrims spend key nights during Hajj and perform the stoning of the Jamarat.
shortDescription: Valley of Tents — the city of pilgrims

scenes.title: The Valley of Mina
scenes.description: Mina is a valley about 8 km east of the Grand Mosque. During Hajj, it hosts over 3 million pilgrims in white tents. The entire valley transforms into a temporary city.

scenes.title: The Jamarat Bridge
scenes.description: Pilgrims stone three pillars (Jamarat) representing the devil. The ritual commemorates Ibrahim's rejection of Shaytan's temptation. Stone each Jamarat with 7 small pebbles, saying 'Allahu Akbar' with each throw.

scenes.title: Masjid al-Khaif
scenes.description: One of the oldest mosques in Islam, located in Mina. The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is reported to have prayed here multiple times. It can accommodate thousands of worshippers.

scenes.title: The Tent City
scenes.description: Modern air-conditioned tents now house pilgrims in Mina. The sight of millions of white tents filling the valley is one of the most powerful images in the world.

title: Mount Arafat
description: A spiritual journey to the mountain of mercy where the Prophet delivered his farewell sermon.

scenes.title: The Plains of Arafat
scenes.description: A vast plain 20km east of Mecca. On the 9th of Dhul Hijjah, millions of pilgrims gather here from midday to sunset in prayer and supplication — the central act of Hajj.

scenes.title: Jabal al-Rahmah
scenes.description: The Hill of Mercy where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) delivered his Farewell Sermon in 632 CE. A white pillar marks the spot. Pilgrims climb it and make dua.

scenes.title: The Farewell Sermon
scenes.description: 'O people, listen to what I say... All mankind is from Adam and Eve. An Arab has no superiority over a non-Arab, nor a non-Arab over an Arab...' — Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), Arafat, 9 Dhul Hijjah 10 AH.
